page.title: 06A Secretary's Day
page.content: Alison Jardine starts at a quarter to nine and finishes at a quarter to five. As a secretary, she takes a lot of telephone calls during the day. She also orders things for the school in February and September. The school gets an allocation of money from the Regional Council. To start off with in the morning the secretary opens all the school mail. Some of that mail is for the Rector or for other teachers. This goes into the pigeon holes in the staffroom. She also does the registration procedures. The names of the pupils who are absent are filled in. She does a lot of typing including audio typing. There is quite a lot of typing to do for both teachers and the Rector.
